channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This little-known AI darling is climbing the Fortune 500 faster than any other company
item.description: Super Micro Computer skyrocketed 206 spots on the Fortune 500, thanks to its pivotal role in powering the AI boom.

item.title: Women run 11% of Fortune 500 companies in 2025—but progress is still slow
item.description: Fifty-five Fortune 500 companies are led by women CEOs this year.

item.title: The largest Fortune 500 company has 2 million employees. These 8 have under 2,000
item.description: These small but mighty companies on the Fortune 500 raked in more than $87 billion in combined revenue over the past year.

item.title: AI-built startups could fuel increase in venture capital ‘zombie’ funds
item.description: The number of zombie VC funds has jumped by 50% since the end of 2021.

item.title: As boomers are forced to ‘unretire’ because they’ve not saved enough, 6-year-olds in Germany could soon have retirement accounts
item.description: Millions of baby boomers can't afford to retire. It’s a fate that Gen Alpha in Germany may never have to face under new plans.

item.title: Here’s what’s worth streaming in June as ‘The Bear’ and ‘Squid Game’ return
Stocks again near record territory. But tariff turmoil, job angst are lurking.
Goldman Sachs brushes aside rising bond yields, sees 10% upside for S&P 500
Fed’s Waller sees path to multiple interest-rate cuts this year
Dow futures drop over 224 points as China accuses U.S. of violating trade truce
